title.narrative: Consolidating Ethiopia's Capacity for Conflict Prevention, Peacebuilding and Governance

description.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Peace, Institute for Strategic Affairs amd other government agencies working on peace and security areas.

Outcome 1: Enhanced knowledge and institutional capacities of government officials, community leaders, and CSOs for conflict prevention, resolution and, peace building at various administrative levels. Outcome 2: Improved political governance and civil society engagement in political decision-making at federal and regional administrative levels

The project aims to support and strengthen Ethiopian Government’s federal and regional capacities for conflict prevention, peacebuilding and governance aimed at contributing to peaceful democratic transition in the country

title.narrative: Consolidating Ethiopia’s Capacity for Conflict Prevention, Peacebuilding and Governance - a conference on the role of Civil society organizations on peace building in Ethiopia

description.narrative: A dialogue between the Ministry of peace and civil society organizations supported and promoted constructive conflict management and peace processes;

title.narrative: The Ministry of Peace and Civil societies discussed and agreed on how to work together to increase the role of CSOs in peace building in Ethiopia

description.narrative: A working group representing CSOs formed after discussion and will be working closely with the Ministry of Peace to coordinate peacebuilng efforts

comment.narrative: On this seminar it is agreed that government bodies need to work closely with the civil society to enhance the role of the civil society in peace building.
Government decision makers and leaders from Civil Society Organizations

Civil society organizations in Ethiopia play limited role in peace builidng in Ethiopia. There is an interest from the civil societies side to have an active role and to play more in the peace buidling process. The governemnt showed its interest to work with civil soociety organization in peace buildings recognizing their irreplaceble roles.

title.narrative: Consolidating Ethiopia’s Capacity for Conflict Prevention, Peacebuilding and Governance - Closed briefing for partners on the peace and secuirty situation in Ethiopia- The Tigray conflict

description.narrative: ISS partners were breifed on the war between Tigray People Libration Front(TPLF) and the Federal Government of Ethiopia. This high level closed briefing helped leaders in the International COmmunity and ISS partners to understand the conflict and its ramifications

title.narrative: High level closed brifeing on TIgray Region Crisis

description.narrative: Closed briefings are one way ISS insures partners are getting quality and well researched information on the peace and security of Ethiopia. Our partners ask for these breifings because they find them very helpful.

comment.narrative: Timely and well reserched closed briefing instill confidence in our partners ISS capability of providing quality information on peace and security issues. These briefings will continue to be one way of engaging our partners from time to time.
International Community partners, Ambassdors based in Addis

During war and crisis time getting real time information and balanced views are difficult. ISS closed briefings are providing these much needed balanced analysis of peace and security issues on timely fashion. Analysis provided in these closed breifings are highly appreciated and most welcomed by partners

title.narrative: Consolidating Ethiopia’s Capacity for Conflict Prevention, Peacebuilding and Governance - Seminar on the impact of Regional Special Forces on the peace and security of Ethiopia

description.narrative: Stakeholders discussed the legality and impact of the regional special forces.

title.narrative: The legality of special forces in regions discussed and mostly agreed its is unconstitunal and needs to fixed and incorparate in to the Federal Police or the Military

description.narrative: Discussion focused as it is one actor of regional conflict in Ethiopia, few weeks after the seminar the Federal government of Ethiopia went in to a war with special forces in Tigray regional state

comment.narrative: This dicussion rasied one of the major issue behind conflicts and security crises between the Federal government and regional states. We expect changes in the set up and governance of regional special security forces
Government decision makers, reserachers, international organizations and students

The legality and practices of special regional forces has been at the center of the peace and security debate in Ethiopia. These informal and powerful security forces in Ethiopia regional states are mentioned whenever regional conflicts arise. This uncosntitional set up of special forces ended up fighting with the Federal government both in Somali and Tigray regions resulting in mass killings, displacements and unprecendated crises.

title.narrative: Consolidating Ethiopia’s Capacity for Conflict Prevention, Peacebuilding and Governance - a monograph on Constitutonal design options

description.narrative: The monograph on design options for Ethiopia constitution followed by a seminar to critic and discuss the research
A well reaserched and debated monograph discussing constituion design options as Ethiopia is going thorugh constititutional crisis at times.

comment.narrative: There are disagreements on the 1995 Ethiopian constitutions. These disagreements come from different directions including from some within the government. This monograph provided different options and presented for political actors in Ethiopia to consider in future debates

The monograph was presented for the General Attorney office and other relevant governmental, non govermental bodies and research orginizationsand discussed the diffrent constitutional design options. This reaseach work is debated and discussed at higher levels and there is an interest from the goverment side to consder the recommendations presented by the research.
